meanings.sent1: The artist wanted to bourgeoisify their work by making it more appealing to the middle class.
meanings.sent2: She decided to bourgeoisify her wardrobe by purchasing more conservative clothing.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to bourgeoisify itself by sitting on top of the fancy armchair.
meanings.sent4: The new regulations would bourgeoisify the neighborhood, changing its character completely.
meanings.sent5: The chef's goal was to bourgeoisify the menu, adding more traditional dishes.

meanings.definition: To conform to the standards and conventions of the middle class.
meanings.sent1: He felt pressured to bourgeoisify his speech to fit in with his new colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to bourgeoisify its image to attract a wider customer base.
meanings.sent3: The rebellious teenager refused to bourgeoisify her style, preferring to stand out.
meanings.sent4: The small town began to bourgeoisify as more upscale stores opened in the area.
meanings.sent5: The old bookstore had to bourgeoisify its collection to keep up with changing tastes.
